Read the following text and write its continuation: 
Areas of Bogotá experienced riots this Friday.

This after "looting" and "acts of vandalism" were recorded on Friday in a new day of protests after the "historic" national strike on Thursday.

Meanwhile, President Iván Duque has committed to a "national conversation" next week to try to ease tensions.

Curfew

Thousands of people had gathered in Bogotá's Plaza Bolívar early Friday following a call from opposition leaders to renew protests.

"We are here to continue protesting against Duque's government," said student Katheryn Martinez, 25, who was with her father Arturo de ella, 55.

End of Maybe you're also interested

However, the crowd dispersed when police began firing tear gas. Witnesses said some protesters regrouped on nearby streets and continued chanting.
output:
There were some acts of vandalism in some sectors of the capital, as a result of which 76 stations and 79 buses of the transportation service known as Transmilenio were affected, as well as several supermarkets.

"This is not a democratic march. What we have here is a minority of criminals who destroy property," the city's mayor, Enrique Peñalosa, said at a press conference.

The official indicated that the curfew would cover the areas of Bosa, Kennedy and Ciudad Bolívar, from 8:00 p.m. this Friday (01:00 UTC on Saturday) until 5:00 a.m. on Saturday.

Later, President Iván Duque announced that the curfew was in effect for the entire capital from 9:00 p.m. and confirmed the deployment of the military in the streets "to guarantee security in places where tranquility is being disturbed." .

Local authorities had already decreed in the morning a dry law throughout the city that will last until noon on Saturday, November 23.

The curfew did not prevent some gatherings of protesters and even "banging with pots and pans" in the Colombian capital.

However, Defense Minister Carlos Holmes Trujillo announced on Friday night that the acts of vandalism were under control in Bogotá and that the curfew was being successful.

"There is no vandalism at the moment, the curfew is 90% respected," he told reporters.

Social dialogue

The president spoke publicly again this Friday. He insisted on "categorically rejecting any form of violence" while announcing the strengthening of the presence of public forces on the streets.

In addition, he repeated that "the government believes in social dialogue" and said that next week it will promote a "national conversation that strengthens the current agenda of social policies."

While he called for a "national conversation," Duque deployed the Army.

instruction: How many types of dinosaurs existed?
output:
A wide variety of dinosaur species have been identified and classified over time, but estimating the exact number of dinosaur types can be an ever-evolving challenge due to new research and discoveries. Although a precise and definitive number cannot be provided, it is estimated that around 1,000 different genera of dinosaurs have been described and cataloged to date.

Dinosaurs varied in size, shape, diet and habitat. They are grouped into several main categories based on their characteristics, and are classified into two main groups: Saurischia (reptile-hipped) and Ornithischia (bird-hipped).

Each group is divided into subgroups and then into genera and species. Some of the best-known dinosaur genera and species include:

- Theropods: This group includes famous predators such as Tyrannosaurus rex and Velociraptor.

- Sauropods: Sauropods were long-necked herbivorous dinosaurs, like Brachiosaurus and Diplodocus.

- Ornithopods: These herbivores include iguanodonts and hadrosaurs, such as Parasaurolophus.

- Marginocephalians: This group includes the ceratopsians, which had horns and ornamental structures, like Triceratops.

- Feathered theropods: It has been discovered that some theropods had feathers, which relates them to modern birds. Examples include Archeopteryx.

It should be noted that the classification of dinosaurs continues to be the subject of research and debate in the scientific community. New fossils and genetic analyzes continue to shed light on the diversity and relationship between different dinosaur species. As more fossil remains are discovered and research techniques are refined, our understanding of the variety of dinosaur types will continue to evolve. Each year, new fossil finds and research advances allow scientists to better understand diversity and history. of the dinosaurs. Therefore, the exact number of types of dinosaurs that existed may continue to be adjusted as more discoveries are made and our knowledge of these fascinating prehistoric creatures expands.

Content: The enormous amount of liquidity in Venezuela promotes corruption. 

From getting a driver's license to buying milk, to finding a job or getting a construction permit, many of the social interactions one has in this oil land often involve some level of corruption.

In Creole terms, the procedures imply that one "pay for a soda", "for a coffee" or, in short, "get off with something" (pay a sum of money). A formula that, alternatively, you can escape if you have "a cousin" or even "a friend" who is well placed (or "plugged in"). Although that does not guarantee that the order will be free, because the "plugged in" in question may well end up asking, and again in Creole, "how much is there for that?"

It is an everyday circle from which it is difficult to escape and ranges from the micro to the highest spheres of the State.

And perhaps this sounds familiar in any country in Latin America, but the case of Venezuela - as confirmed this Tuesday once again by Transparency International's (TI) corruption perception index - has unique characteristics on the continent.

End of Maybe you're also interested

Among the 177 countries included in the report, composed with the opinion of hundreds of experts and specialized entities, Venezuela is in 160th place, with 20 points out of 100.

Of the Latin American countries, only Haiti is behind Venezuela, with 19 points. And Somalia, North Korea and Afghanistan - with 8 points - are considered the most corrupt countries in the world.

Since the report began to be published in 1993, Venezuela has always been among the countries considered most corrupt.

But what makes the case of corruption in this country so particular?

Size, control, research

The American Robert Klitgaard defines corruption as the use of a position of power for individual ends.

Not only of political power, but of any kind: from the security guard who does business with the parking lots to the
output: Carrying out a procedure in Venezuela is not only a matter of having the papers in order. Also to know someone who will speed it up. Or pay a "commission" to guarantee it.

instruction: Could you explain to me what the final judgment will be like according to the Book of Revelation, thank you very much.
output:
The last judgment, also known as the judgment of Revelation or the final judgment according to the Book of Revelation, is a biblical prophecy found in the last book of the New Testament in the Christian Bible. The Book of Revelation, written by the apostle John, is a highly symbolic and apocalyptic book that describes visions and revelations related to the end times and the final judgment.

It is important to note that interpretations of the Book of Revelation can vary between different religious beliefs and theologians. Below I will provide an overview of the final judgment according to Christian tradition, based on the content of the Book of Revelation:

The seven seals: The Book of Revelation describes seven seals that are opened one by one. Each seal represents an event or judgment that will be unleashed on the earth before the final judgment.

The Seven Trumpets: After the seals are opened, seven angels blow seven trumpets, unleashing additional judgments and disasters on the earth.

The seven bowls: After the trumpets, seven angels pour out seven bowls of God's wrath on the earth, symbolizing the final judgment and the end of time.

The judgment of the nations: In the Book of Revelation, a judgment is mentioned in which all nations will be gathered before God, and each person will be judged according to his works and actions during his earthly life.

The Great White Throne Judgment: The Book of Revelation describes a final judgment, known as the Great White Throne Judgment. In this judgment, the dead will be resurrected, and all will appear before God to give an account of their lives. Those whose names are not written in the Book of Life will be thrown into the lake of fire, representing eternal damnation.

The New Jerusalem: After the final judgment, according to the Book of Revelation, a new heavenly Jerusalem will be established, a place where the righteous and the redeemed will live in peace and harmony with God forever.

It is essential to remember that the Book of Revelation is based on symbolic and apocalyptic visions, and that interpretations can vary widely. For many believers, the central message is hope in God's final victory and the promise of eternal life for those who follow his will and believe in their salvation through Jesus Christ.

instruction: Why is the Sun so big and there are no humans living there?
output:
The Sun is a star and is much larger than the Earth due to the nature of its formation and function in the cosmos. Here are the main reasons:

1. Star formation: The Sun formed from a cloud of gas and dust in a region of our galaxy known as the Milky Way. These clouds collapse under the influence of gravity, causing an increase in temperature and pressure in the core. When these conditions reach certain thresholds, nuclear fusion begins in the core, converting hydrogen to helium and releasing enormous amounts of energy in the form of light and heat. This nuclear fusion is what keeps the Sun shining and generating energy.

2. Size and composition: The Sun has an approximate diameter of around 1.4 million kilometers, which is about 109 times the diameter of the Earth. Its volume is approximately 1.3 million times the volume of the Earth. This is due to the massive amount of material that condensed in the core during its formation, and the extremely high pressure and temperature in the core allow nuclear fusion to occur.

3. Temperature and gravity: The temperature at the core of the Sun is extremely high, reaching around 15 million degrees Celsius (27 million degrees Fahrenheit). This high temperature and the enormous mass of the Sun generate significant gravity, which maintains the balance between the expansion force of the energy released by fusion and the gravitational pull towards the center.

4. Inhospitable environment: The Sun is not a suitable place for human life due to its extreme conditions. The Sun's surface, called the photosphere, has temperatures of about 5,500 degrees Celsius (9,932 degrees Fahrenheit). In addition, the outer layers of the Sun, such as the corona, are much hotter and emit intense radiation such as X-rays and ultraviolet rays. These conditions would make life as we know it on Earth impossible.

In short, the Sun is so large because of its formation as a star and the nuclear fusion that occurs in its core. The extreme conditions and high temperatures on the Sun make it inhospitable to human life, and living there would be impossible due to the intense radiation and extreme temperatures.

Passage: Some civil disobedients feel it is incumbent on them to accept punishment because of their belief in the validity of the social contract, which is held to force everyone to obey the laws that a government meeting certain standards of legitimacy has established or suffer the consequences. sanctions established by law. instruction: Who is a poor storyteller?
output:
The poor narrator knows "less than the protagonist" about the story. He records only what can be seen and heard, without entering the minds of any of the characters. For this reason, this type of narrator can also be called an objective narrator, because he does not include any subjectivity in his narration (neither his own nor that of any character).

This narrator, therefore, is a mere witness of the events that occur in the narrative, and is the most used in journalistic narration.

instruction: Who was Victor Jara?
output:
Víctor Lidio Jara Martínez (1932-1973) was a Chilean musician, singer-songwriter, teacher, writer, and theater director.

The figure of Víctor Jara is an international reference for protest songs, although he never felt completely identified with that definition. He was one of the most emblematic of the musical-social movement called "New Chilean Song", and one of the pillars in Latin American music.

After the coup d'état that overthrew the government of Salvador Allende on September 11, 1973, Jara was arrested the next day by the Armed Forces of the newly established military dictatorship, due to his militancy in the Communist Party of Chile. He was tortured by cutting off his fingers and tongue so that he could not play his guitar or sing while insults were hurled at him. After four days, he was murdered with more than forty shots in the old Chile Stadium, which with the return of democracy was renamed "Víctor Jara Stadium."

instruction: What is the difference between mitosis and meiosis?
output: The main difference between the processes of mitosis and meiosis is determined by the function played by each process, mitosis being the division of the nucleus of any cell of an organism (somatic cells), necessary for the growth and renewal of said cells; Meiosis, on the other hand, is carried out exclusively by the cells involved in the reproduction process, with the aim of exchanging genetic information between the nuclei of two sexual cells of different organisms and thus increasing the genetic diversity and survival of the species.

instruction: Write a story for a five-year-old child, taking the idea of ​​the Little Prince, in a new and original version in 500 words.
output:
Nico and the cosmic odyssey 
Once upon a time there was a little explorer named Nico, who lived on a tiny planet far away, called Littleland. In Littleland, everything was so small that the flowers looked like bright little stars and the mountains looked like soft green hills.

One day, while Nico was playing among the flowers, he saw something shiny among the petals. It was a little gold star! He took it in her hands and looked at her in amazement. The little star began to shine even brighter and, suddenly, she spoke: "Hello, Nico, I am Estela, a traveling star. I have come to Littleland to learn about your wonders."

Nico was very excited and decided to show Estela all the corners of her little world. Together they explored the magical little forest, where the trees whispered stories and the birds sang enchanted melodies. Afterwards, they climbed the Emerald Mountain, where they found little laughing elves who gave them laughter and joy.

On their journey, they also met Cloud, a laughing cloud that floated through the blue sky and took them to fly through the fluffy clouds. From there, Nico and Estela saw the little stars in the sky, and Estela told them stories about other planets and distant galaxies.

One day, while they were walking near the river of crystal clear water, they found a strange little creature. It was round and had small wings. "Hello, I'm Alita! I'm Littleland's last dragonfly," she said sadly. "No one has noticed that I'm the last one, everyone is too busy to notice my existence."

Nico and Estela felt sad for Alita and decided to help her. Together they built a small shelter for dragonflies, and little by little, more dragonflies began to arrive in Littleland. Alita no longer felt alone, and the dragonflies became the guardians of the magical little forest.

Over time, Nico and Estela became great friends. Every day, they traveled around Littleland exploring and discovering new wonders. One day, while they were at the top of Emerald Mountain, Nico asked Estela if she wanted to stay in Littleland with him. "I would love to, Nico, but I am a traveling star and I must continue my path through the universe," Estela responded with a smile.

Nico became a little sad, but he knew that he would always have the memories of his adventure with Estela in his heart. And so, with a warm hug and a sparkle in her eyes, Estela said goodbye to Nico and continued her journey.

From that day on, Nico never stopped exploring Littleland. He always remembered Estela and looked at the sky, knowing that, somewhere, his star friend continued to shine. And although Nico never saw her again, the magic of her friendship made Littleland an even more special place full of wonder.

And so, this little explorer learned that friendship has no borders and that, although the stars may be far away, they will always shine in the hearts of those who love them.

End.

instruction:
Make a summary, with the most relevant aspects of the following article:

Here are some general guidelines and precautions to keep in mind during a thunderstorm in different scenarios:

At home:

1. Stay inside your home and avoid using electronic devices connected to the power.
2. Avoid using corded landlines during the storm.
3. Keep windows closed and avoid touching metal surfaces.
4. Unplug appliances and electronic devices to prevent damage from power surges.
5. Avoid contact with taps and running water, as electricity can travel through pipes.

On the street:

1. Seek shelter in a solid building or a closed vehicle as soon as you hear thunder.
2. Avoid taking shelter under tall trees, electrical poles and metal structures.
3. Stay away from bodies of water, such as swimming pools, lakes and rivers.
4. Do not use umbrellas or long metal objects.
5. Keep a safe distance from other people to avoid the risk of side discharge.

In the field or open areas:

1. Seek shelter in a building or closed vehicle as soon as you hear thunder.
2. Avoid staying in elevated areas, hills or open fields.
3. If there is no shelter nearby, crouch in a squatting position, keeping your feet together and your hands covering your ears.
4. Keep a safe distance from tall trees, electric poles and metal objects.

Remember that during a thunderstorm, it is important to prioritize your safety. Stay calm, follow the instructions above and make sure you are well informed about how to act in an emergency.
output: The article provides essential tips for staying safe during thunderstorms in different situations. At home, it is suggested to avoid connected electronic devices and corded phones, close windows, unplug appliances and not touch metal surfaces. Outdoors, it is advisable to take shelter in solid buildings or vehicles when hearing thunder, avoid tall and metallic objects, and keep distance from bodies of water. In open areas, seek shelter in buildings or crouch when hearing thunder, avoiding elevated areas and metal objects. The priority of safety, calm and following directions in emergency situations is emphasized.

instruction: What is enriched air and why is it used for diving?
output: Enriched air, also known as nitrox, is a type of air with more than 21% of the normal concentration oxygen that we breathe on earth. The main benefit of using enriched air is to extend the diver's dive time, and reduce the need to reach the decompression limit. This is really beneficial on deeper diving. For example, at 80 feet deep, normal air can last about 30 min, while enriched air, 32% oxygen, can last 45 min and 36% can last 55 min.

instruction: Explain the binary search algorithm briefly.
output:
The classic example of this algorithm is to search for a value in an ordered list. Instead of reviewing each element in the list, we can choose the middle element and compare it with the value we want to search for, if it is greater than said value then we discard the right half of the list, and if it is less then we discard the left half of the list. the list, and we continue doing this algorithm until the list we search in has only one element.
Since this algorithm halves the number of candidates in each iteration, its time complexity is O(log n) where n is the initial length of the list.
An example of an implementation would be this:

```Python
def binary_search(list: list, value: int):
    left = 0
    right = len(arr)
    while left < right:
        mid = (left + right) // 2
        if list[mid] < value:
            left = mid + 1
        else:
            right = middle
    if list[left] == ​​value:
        return True
    return False
```

instruction: What important event is this text about?: In 1818 he had been assigned with his unit to the Expeditionary Army, destined for Overseas, which at that time was meeting in the vicinity of Cádiz. He supported the pronouncement of Lieutenant Colonel Rafael del Riego, who restored the Constitution of 1812. Quiroga was the highest-ranking soldier among the rebels and was elected general on the ground by the rest of the officers. The promotion was confirmed by the Liberal government following the success of the pronouncement, and he was soon elevated to field marshal and awarded the Grand Cross of the Order of San Fernando. He fought against the One Hundred Thousand Sons of Saint Louis who, commanded by the Duke of Angoulême, came to the aid of Ferdinand VII so that he could recover absolute power. In 1823 his troops capitulated to the French army in La Coruña. After the absolutist triumph he went into exile in London where he remained until 1834. After the death of Ferdinand VII and the end of the Ominous Decade he returned to Spain as lieutenant general and held the position of captain general of New Castile. He also represented Galicia in the Cortes of which he was vice president. He died in Madrid in 1841.
output:
This text is about the pronouncement of Lieutenant General Rafael del Riego in 1820 and his subsequent leadership in the Spanish Liberal Revolution of 1820-1823. During this period, Riego led a military pronouncement in support of the Constitution of 1812, which led to the restoration of said document and established a liberal government in Spain. After his initial success, he became a leading figure in the liberal movement and was promoted to general and later to field marshal.

However, in 1823, absolutist forces led by the Duke of Angoulême and known as "the Hundred Thousand Sons of Saint Louis" intervened in Spain to restore the absolute power of King Ferdinand VII. This led to the defeat of Riego and his troops at La Coruña, after which he went into exile in London until 1834, when he returned to Spain after the death of Ferdinand VII and the end of the absolutist "Ominous Decade."

The text also mentions that Rafael del Riego held the position of captain general of New Castile and represented Galicia in the Cortes, where he also served as vice president. He finally died in Madrid in 1841.

Construction began in the 7th century BC. and it continued for centuries. The Qin Dynasty (221-206 BC) is famous for unifying existing walls into a single structure. The wall stretched for thousands of kilometers and was built from a variety of materials, including stone, brick and earth. Today, it is one of the most recognized historical sites in the world.

instruction:
According to the paragraph shown below, is it correct to affirm that the three Pinzón Brothers were equally recognized? 

The Pinzón brothers—Martín Alonso Pinzón, Vicente Yáñez Pinzón and Francisco Martín Pinzón—were Spanish sailors and explorers from the late 15th century and early 16th century, all three members of the Pinzón family and natives of Palos de la Frontera (Huelva). who actively participated in Christopher Columbus's first voyage, which resulted in the discovery of America in 1492, and in other voyages of exploration. They were sailors of outstanding prestige in the coastal region of Huelva, and thanks to their different commercial and cabotage voyages they acquired fame and a comfortable situation, which allowed them to enjoy respect and recognition among their contemporaries.​ The strategic position offered by the historic port from Palos, from where expeditions left both to the African coasts and to the war against Portugal, allowed it to be the place from which most of their fleets departed, organized, on many occasions, by this family. Martín Alonso and Vicente Yáñez, captains of the caravels Pinta and Niña, respectively, are the best-known brothers, but there is a third, less popular, who was aboard La Pinta as master: Francisco Martín. Martín Alonso was the man thanks to whom the sailors of the Tinto-Odiel area were encouraged to participate in the Colombian company. He also financially supported the project by contributing money from his personal estate. Francisco, the master of La Pinta, seems that, in addition to the first, he also participated in the third and fourth of the Columbian voyages, but, because his name is very common, his biographical data is confused with other namesakes of his time. Finally, Vicente Yáñez, the youngest of the three brothers, in addition to participating in Columbus's first voyage, once the Columbian monopoly ended, he made other voyages of discovery on his own, among which the discovery of Brazil should be highlighted. .
output: No, the text indicates that the brothers Martín Alonso and Vicente Yáñez were recognized captains, while the third brother, Francisco Martín, was master of a ship and had a name so common for the time that his records are confused with those of his namesakes. , making it the least popular.

instruction: Regarding dermatology, What is a Pustule?
output: Pustule (from lat. pustula) in medicine is what is called a small superficial cavity of the skin (epidermal or sub-epidermal) filled with pus. The pustule belongs to the so-called primary skin changes (primary efflorescences) in dermatology. Its contents are purulent, it may be sterile (as in "generalized pustular psoriasis") or contain bacteria.  It is a clinical sign of several diseases or pathological processes such as acne.

instruction: Explains time complexity in the context of competitive programming in an informal way.
output:
The analysis of the time complexity of an algorithm is a technique that allows us to understand how fast an algorithm is without having to implement it or run the program.
The idea is the following: under standard computational models (for example, Random Access Machine), certain atomic operations can be defined, such as adding, subtracting, multiplying and dividing two numbers, also modifying a byte or accessing a memory location. So, we can define the complexity of a program according to the number of atomic operations performed with respect to the size of the input.

It is worth mentioning that although we consider all atomic operations equally cheap, in reality they are not; for example, multiplication is more expensive than addition. Because of that, we ignore the constants in our analysis, and we worry more about the growth of the number of operations.

For example, the following loops in Python have the same computational complexity, although one does n iterations, another does 3*n + 2 iterations, and the other does n/2 iterations.

sum = 0
for i in range(n):
sum += i

for i in range(3*n + 2):
sum += i

for i in range(n//2):
sum += i

The most popular computational complexities are:
- logarithmic: O(log n), when the number of operations grows linearly as n grows exponentially. An example is binary search.
- linear: O(n), when the number of operations is proportional to n, for example, linear search.
- O(n log n), for example sorting a list of n elements with the merge sort algorithm.
- O(n^2), for example sorting a list of n elements with the bubble sort algorithm.
- O(2^n), exponential, for example extracting all subsets from a set of size n.

Read the following text and write a summary of it:
"Ghosting", the cruel way to end relationships in the digital age\nGhosting is something that more and more people have to face. (Photo: ThinkStock)

Without warning, that person stops answering your texts and calls. He simply disappears from your life without giving any kind of explanation.

If you have experienced something similar, you have been a victim of what they call ghosting in English, a word that would be translated as "playing the ghost" and that has been gaining popularity in recent times, being chosen as one of the words of 2015 by the British dictionary. Collins.

Ending a relationship overnight, cutting off all types of communication, is nothing new, although according to experts new technologies have made it now a more common practice.

At a time when many relationships begin through websites and cell phone applications, ghosting is something that more and more people have to deal with.

End of Maybe you're also interested

Consequences

Psychological experts warn that ghosting has consequences for both those who suffer it and those who practice it.

Teenagers grow up thinking that not responding to a message is normal. (Photo: ThinkStock)

The first sees his damaged self-esteem and has to go through the period of mourning that comes with the end of a relationship, without having all the answers about the reasons for the breakup.

The second, if it is a consolidated relationship, will have to face the remorse and the feeling of guilt for having left someone in this way.

Experts maintain that in some cases those who practice ghosting are afraid of conflict, avoiding confrontations at all costs, including having to tell someone to their face that they want to end a relationship.

In a survey conducted in 2014 in the United States by the company YouGov for the Huffington Post site, 11% of participants said they had ghosted someone and 13% said they had been a victim of this practice.
output: This article tells us about the consequences of ghosting, this is when you meet someone, you exchange phone numbers, you have several dates, you start a relationship, everything seems to be going well and suddenly... That person disconnects and never speaks to you again. .

instruction: What does the question refer to: "Eucharistic adoration is a practice in the Roman Catholic Church and in some Anglican and Lutheran churches, in which the Blessed Sacrament is exposed and adored by the faithful"? The topic is Eucharistic adoration.
output:
The question refers to the religious practice of "Eucharistic adoration." This is a common practice in the Roman Catholic Church and is also found in some Anglican and Lutheran churches. In this form of worship, the "Blessed Sacrament", which refers to the host consecrated during the celebration of mass, is publicly displayed for the faithful to adore and venerate.

During the Catholic mass, the bread and wine are consecrated by a priest, believing that they become the body and blood of Jesus Christ. The consecrated host is reserved in a special place called the tabernacle so that it can be taken to the sick or for moments of Eucharistic adoration.

Eucharistic adoration is an act of deep respect and devotion to Jesus Christ, whom Catholics and some Anglican and Lutheran churches believe to be truly and substantially present in the Eucharist. During Eucharistic adoration, the faithful prostrate, pray, sing and meditate in the presence of Christ in the consecrated host, considering it as a form of intimate encounter with God.

It is important to mention that Eucharistic adoration is a specific practice within the Christian tradition and can vary in its emphasis and rituals between different churches and Christian communities.

instruction: Which of the following people did NOT write Observations on the Geology of the United States: William Smith or William Maclure? Taking into account the previous question, write a text that contains the answer. It can be from 1 to 20 sentences.
output: The first geological map of the United States was produced in 1809 by William Maclure. In 1807, Maclure began the self-imposed task of making a geological survey of the United States. Almost all the states of the Union were crossed and mapped by him, the Allegheny Mountains were crossed and recrossed about 50 times. The results of his unaided labors were presented to the American Philosophical Society in a memoir entitled Observations on the Geology of the United States Explanatory of a Geological Map, and published in the Transactions of the Society, together with the first geological map of the nation. . This predates William Smith's geological map of England by six years, although it was constructed using a different classification of rocks.

instruction: What are variations of the same language called? Considering the previous question, write a context that contains the answer. It can be from 1 to 20 sentences. The context:
output: First, it is essential to define some terms to improve the understanding of linguistic variation. To distinguish between two or more variants of a language, linguists speak of dialects, or varieties of a language. For example, the Spanish of the Canary Islands has different characteristics that are not present in the Spanish of Castilla-La Mancha. Also, when there is a set of dialects, or varieties, it is called a macrodialect. For example, the set of Cuban, Dominican, and Puerto Rican dialects forms the 'Caribbean' macrodialect. Finally, the distinctiveness that forms the linguistic particularity of an individual is called idiolect, and is unique in that it includes the use of vocabulary, grammar, and pronunciation of that particular individual. From all this, it is important to understand that each language began as a dialect of another and is made up of a set of varieties that can transform over time. For example, Spanish, French, Italian, Portuguese, Roman, Catalan, Galician, and many other languages ​​come from Latin, and at one time were just a dialect of Latin. Over several centuries they were recognized as independent languages.

instruction: When was Cuba discovered?

Cuba was one of the first major islands in the Caribbean to be visited by European explorers in the period of colonization of the New World.

In his writings, Columbus praised the beauty of Cuba and described it as "the most beautiful land that human eyes have ever seen." instruction: What does the term gentrification refer to?
output: The term gentrification refers to a given process within the capitalist market economy, which implies the transformation of a deteriorated or declining urban space, based on reconstruction or rehabilitation due to changes in market dynamics and the increase in demand for commercial and residential spaces. In turn, it can derive from new urban and architectural intervention plans given by both public and private entities that seek to promote market growth in the area of ​​influence. Usually this can lead to traditional residents leaving the neighborhood and settling in more peripheral spaces, which means that this "new" space ends up being occupied by social classes with greater economic capacity that allows them to face these new costs. This process has special relevance in recent years in cities with significant tourism potential and economic relevance.

The flooding of Lake Enriquillo has swept away a beach, a source of sulphurous water and has driven away the flamingos, but he can still show visitors the iguanas and crocodiles and take them on excursions to Cabrito Island.

Like the tourists, that island, a piece of land inside the lake, shrinks every year.

His neighbour Ángel Lucas has had worse luck. Before the waters began to rise he lived off the land and cattle. But the lake swallowed up his yucca, sweet potato and banana plantations and left his seven cattle without food, so he was forced to sell them.
You may also be interested in:

"The water took everything," Lucas laments in conversation with BBC Mundo. "It left us poor. We didn't even know what to eat around here."

"My land was up there (on the mountain) and I thought the lake would never reach there. People who have died over a hundred years ago say that the lake never reached the extremes it is now," says this 49-year-old resident of La Descubierta, one of the communities surrounding Lake Enriquillo.

"Imagine what it feels like when you see your land, take the road to the conucos (crops) and you can't find your daily bread, just imagine."

Mystery

The lake has left many residents of Independencia and Barohuoco without work.

What is a tragedy for Lucas, Montero and thousands of families in the Dominican provinces of Independencia and Bahoruco is a mystery for scientists.

The volume of Lake Enriquillo has doubled in the last decade. And just 5 kilometers away, on the other side of the border, Lake Azuei, the largest in Haiti, follows the same trend.

When the flooding began in 2004, lakes Enriquillo and Azuei were separated by 10 kilometres, but according to research by the City College of New York (CUNY), that figure...
Summarise the text in simple language.
output: Lake Enriquillo, the same lake that provides work, could take it away if its waters continue to grow at the devilish rate of the last decade.

instruction:
Summarize the following text:
The stars who can't escape their most famous characters (and some who can), for example, Will Smith continued his career after "The Fresh Prince" but his co-star Alfonso Ribeiro has struggled.

But the problem sometimes comes later, when they want to continue with his career but find it impossible to leave behind the iconic character who made them famous.

The actor who most recently complained about being stuck in a role is Alfonso Ribeiro.

You may know him as Carlton Banks, Will Smith's cocky cousin on the '90s series The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air (also known as "The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air" in Spain and "The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air" in some countries). parts of Latin America).

Ribeiro, 45, told London newspaper Metro that being hidden in the shadow of his character "didn't allow him to be an actor."

"He forced me to become my character, like hosting game shows or America's Funniest Videos," he lamented.

"I would like to try roles that are different from how the world sees me... I could be a demented killer!" he noted.

"But I highly doubt anyone would think: We need to hire someone to play the killer, so why don't we call the guy who played Carlton."

However, he acknowledged that this role "was rewarding for many reasons" and one could say that an actor is lucky if he gets even one popular role in his career. 

Here we compile a list of actors who have found it impossible to leave their most famous characters behind. And we name some who did manage to reinvent themselves. 

Mark Hamill

Perhaps the most famous case of an actor known for a single role is that of Mark Hamill, who is and always will be Luke Skywalker.

Mark Hamill never managed to break away from the role of Luke Skywalker.

The films that Hamill starred in, outside of the Star Wars saga, were never successful so the actor went to Broadway and took the lead role in the play Amadeus in 1983.
output:
The text talks about actors who became associated with famous people and have found it difficult to get rid of that image, such as Alfonso Ribeiro, known for playing Carlton Banks in "The Fresh Prince of Rap." He also mentions Mark Hamill, who will always be remembered for his role as Luke Skywalker in "Star Wars." Some actors managed to reinvent themselves, but others remain linked to their iconic characters.

instruction:
Summarize the following text:

Prime Minister Boris Johnson decided to suspend Parliament for 5 weeks, from September 10 to October 13, and Queen Elizabeth II gave her approval.

Johnson's initiative comes at a time when British parliamentarians were preparing to return to work after the holiday break and a few weeks before the deadline for Brexit, the process of leaving the United Kingdom, to take place. Kingdom of the European Union, set for October 31.

It is not the first time that this measure has been adopted, but Johnson's decision caused confusion among thousands of British citizens, who took to the streets of the country to protest.

Many consider it to be a strategy by the prime minister to avoid a vote of no confidence by Parliament and thus force the United Kingdom to leave the EU without an agreement, what is known as a hard Brexit.
output: Prime Minister Boris Johnson suspended the British Parliament for 5 weeks, from September 10 to October 13, with the approval of Queen Elizabeth II. This move came at a crucial time, just before the October 31 Brexit deadline. The decision generated confusion and protests by thousands of British citizens. Many consider it to be Johnson's strategy to avoid a vote of no confidence and achieve a no-deal Brexit, known as a hard Brexit.

instruction: What was the Antioch Railway?
output: The Antioquia Railway was a cargo and passenger railway network in Colombia. Its construction began in 1874 and officially ended with its inauguration in 1929. The railway linked the central region of the department of Antioquia, Colombia, with the Magdalena River, located to the east of the center of Antioquia, and with the provinces located to the south of the department, this is: Caldas and Valle del Cauca. The Antioquia Railway took this province out of its historical geographical isolation in relation to the rest of Colombia for several centuries.

instruction: Write the most important event in the text: Karađorđe's descendants adopted the surname Karađorđević in his honor. His assassination led to a violent and protracted dispute between his and Obrenović's descendants, with the Serbian throne changing hands several times. The dispute came to an abrupt end in June 1903, when rebellious Royal Serbian Army officers killed King Obrenović, Aleksandr, and his wife, Queen Draga, thus extinguishing the Obrenović line. Karađorđe's grandson, Petar Karađorđević, later ascended the throne. To tie into his grandfather's legacy, Petar commissioned a bronze crown from an early Karađorđe cannon. Additionally, the Order of the Star of Karađorđe was presented as the highest state decoration in Serbia. The first feature film to emerge from Serbia and the Balkans, whose plot revolves around Karađorđe and his actions before, during and after the first Serbian uprising, was released in 1911. Construction soon began on the Church of St. George, a mausoleum of the Karađorđević dynasty in Oplenac, near Topola. In November 1918, Petar ascended the throne of the newly established Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes, which was later renamed Yugoslavia. Karađorđe's head was repatriated from Greece in 1923 and reunited with the rest of his body. His remains were buried in a white marble sarcophagus inside the church in 1930. The Karađorđević dynasty ruled Yugoslavia until 1941, when its members were forced into exile by the German invasion and occupation of the country. The monarchy was abolished by the communist government of Josip Broz Tito in 1945.
output: The most important event in the text was the German invasion and occupation.

instruction: Summarize the article: Walmart is editing an ad after viewers complained about its use of the line "I can't breathe" reminiscent of the case of Eric Garner, who was killed by a police officer after shouting those words. The ad features an African-American father and his daughter sitting on a couch, discussing the benefits of a Walmart family wireless plan. Unbeknownst to his daughter, the father stopped at the retail chain and bought her a cell phone. When he gives it to her, she screams and gives him a big hug with her hands around his neck. "I can't breathe," the father says jokingly. Those three words have become a rallying cry for protesters across the country after Garner's July 17 death in a videotaped incident in New York City. In the recording, a white NYPD officer puts him in a chokehold that causes him to fall to the ground. Garner, who is black, says "I can't breathe" a few times during the incident. He died shortly after. A grand jury said Wednesday that it will not indict the officer, Daniel Pantaleo, sending outraged demonstrators to protest the decision. Walmart said Thursday that it has received some criticism for the ad and will review it as a result. "We are reissuing as we speak based on the feedback we have received," the retailer posted on Twitter. "We can see how the ad might be viewed differently today than when it first aired." Danielle Ramos, who lives in New York City, was one of the people who tweeted at Walmart about the ad, she wrote: "Walmart did you really just air a commercial in New York where a black girl has her arm around her neck?" of his father and he says: I can't breathe?" Ramos said she's glad the retailer is reconsidering the ad. "The decision to edit it given the current climate is appreciated," Ramos said. "I don't think it was a big company intentionally being insensitive. I think maybe they weren't aware of how deeply affected the nation is by all of this." But Eric Lewis said there's nothing wrong with the ad. "It's a nice, happy ad."
output: Walmart is editing an ad in response to viewer complaints about its use of the phrase "I can't breathe." The ad features an African-American father and his daughter discussing the benefits of a Walmart family wireless plan. Giving his daughter a cell phone, the father jokes, "I can't breathe." These words relate to the case of Eric Garner, who died after being subdued by a police officer while repeating those same words. Walmart has received criticism and has decided to review the advertisement. The company said it is reissuing the ad based on feedback received and recognizes that it could be perceived differently in the current context. Some viewers, like Danielle Ramos, applaud the decision to edit the ad, considering it was insensitive in the current climate. However, there are people like Eric Lewis who see nothing wrong with the ad and consider it just a cute, happy ad.

instruction: What is telepathy?
output:
Telepathy is a concept that refers to the supposed ability to transmit or receive thoughts, emotions or information directly between two people without using conventional physical senses, such as hearing or vision. In other words, it would be direct mental communication between individuals, where information is transferred from mind to mind non-verbally.

Although the idea of ​​telepathy has been popularized in literature and popular culture, there is no solid scientific evidence to support its existence. Telepathy goes against our current understanding of how the brain and communication between human beings works. Over the years, numerous experiments and studies have been conducted to investigate telepathy, but their results have been inconsistent and have not proven the existence of this ability in scientific terms.

instruction: Hello, I don't have much experience with artificial intelligence but I would like to use a model to segment medical images from my work. What do you recommend me?

instruction: Give me an example of trivia in this category: History.
output:
Which ancient civilization created aqueducts to move water to the city? The Inca and Roman civilization.

Two ancient civilizations created aqueducts to move water to their cities, they were the Roman civilization and the Inca civilization. The Roman civilization built elevated aqueducts with arches, while the Inca civilization developed underground systems or open canals, such as "qanats" or "puquios", to ensure the supply of water from natural springs and streams. Both civilizations demonstrated remarkable skill in hydraulic engineering to meet the water needs of their settlements and agricultural fields.

instruction: Summarize the article: (CNN) Two of Syria's neighbors joined growing international calls on Monday for Damascus to stop its violent crackdown on anti-government protesters, calls that came even as the violence itself continued. Al Bakhit told Safar in a phone call that "such scenes" must stop, adding that "there is still hope in the ability of our brothers in Syria to achieve this end." "In Jordan we expect tangible and urgent measures in the near future," he said. Similar sentiments were expressed in Ankara by Turkish Foreign Minister Ahmet Davutoglu after his recent visit to Damascus. He told reporters in a televised news conference that he had called for the Syrian army to end operations immediately, withdraw from the cities and meet the people's democratic demands. "The Syrian people must know that we are on their side when it comes to their legitimate democratic rights," he said. "We hope that our voice is heard and that these operations are stopped." In Jeddah, Saudi Arabia, Turkish President Abdullah Gul met with King Abdullah of Saudi Arabia on Monday and the two "underscored the importance of stopping the violence that the Syrian administration is resorting to against the people," Gul's office said. it's a statement. Last week, King Abdullah called for an end to the bloodshed in Syria and recalled the Saudi ambassador from Damascus. Bahrain and Kuwait have also withdrawn their ambassadors from Syria and called on Syrian President Bashar al-Assad to end the repression. The United States has not explicitly called for Assad to resign, but Washington has said Syria would be better off without him. The United States imposed sanctions on Syria's largest mobile phone company and a bank, while calling...

instruction: What is AWS?
output: Amazon Web Services (abbreviated AWS) is a collection of public cloud computing services (also called web services) that together form a cloud computing platform, offered over the Internet by Amazon.com. instruction:
A prime (or prime) number is a natural number greater than 1 that has no positive divisors other than 1 and itself. A natural number greater than 1 that is not a prime number is called a composite number. For example, 5 is prime because 1 and 5 are its only positive integer factors, while 6 is composite because it has the divisors 2 and 3 in addition to 1 and 6. The fundamental theorem of arithmetic states the central role of primes in number theory: any integer greater than 1 can be expressed as a product of primes that is unique up to the order. The uniqueness of this theorem requires excluding 1 as a prime because arbitrarily many instances of 1 can be included in any factorization, e.g., 3, 1 · 3, 1 · 1 · 3, etc. They are all valid factorizations of 3.

instruction: Explain to me in simple words what quantum mechanics is, please.
output:
Quantum mechanics is a branch of physics that studies the behavior of the smallest particles that make up matter, such as atoms and subparticles (electrons, protons, neutrons, etc.). This theory was developed at the beginning of the 20th century and has revolutionized our understanding of the world at a microscopic level.

Simple words to explain quantum mechanics:

Particles: They are the smallest units that make up everything in the universe, such as atoms and their components.

Behavior: Describes how these tiny particles move, interact, and relate to each other.

Uncertainty: In quantum mechanics, the position and velocity of a particle cannot be accurately predicted at the same time.

Wave-particle duality: Microscopic particles can behave like particles and like waves at the same time, showing sometimes counterintuitive behaviors.

Superposition: A particle can be in multiple states at once until it is observed.

Quantum entanglement: Separate particles can be instantly connected, even over great distances, meaning that what happens to one particle affects another instantaneously.

Pauli exclusion principle: Two identical particles cannot occupy the same quantum state at the same time.

Quantum leaps: Particles can change their quantum state instantaneously and discretely, rather than changing continuously.

In summary, quantum mechanics is the theory that allows us to understand the behavior of the smallest particles in the universe, showing that in the microscopic world, the rules are different from those we are used to in our daily reality.
Thanks so much for reading.

instruction:

Juan has just started learning about multilayer perceptrons, specifically the inputs, outputs, layers, and nodes of a neural network. It's a lot for a single day of study, but Juan doesn't want to go home without having understood some basic ideas. He has devised a simple rule: assuming he had two networks, one with more nodes than the other, this network must also have more connections. What do you think of John's rule?

Juan is correct: the network with more nodes will always have more connections than the one with fewer nodes.
Juan is wrong: the network with fewer nodes will always have more connections than the one with more nodes.
Juan is wrong: every multilayer perceptron has the same number of connections.
Juan is wrong: either network can have more connections than the other, regardless of the number of nodes.
output:
John's rule is incorrect. For example, let's imagine a network with three layers:

The first layer with 64 nodes.
The second layer with 8 nodes.
The third layer with 64 nodes.
This network has a total of 136 nodes and 1,024 connections.

The second network will have only two layers:
The first layer with 64 nodes.
The second layer also with 64 nodes.
This network has a total of 128 nodes and 4,096 connections.

Although the first network has more nodes than the second (136 versus 128), the second has more connections (4,096 versus 1,024). Therefore, the correct answer to this question is the fourth option.

instruction: What colors is the flag of Mexico?

Popular belief says that the flag colors originated from the flag of the Army of the Three Guarantees or "Trigarante Flag", in 1821, but as to the form or method of selection is at least uncertain. Some, for example, believe that it is a copy of the colors of the Italian flag, since the Italian flag has its origin in a banner with those same colors that was delivered by Napoleon in November 1796 to a body of Italian volunteers of the Lombard Legion. . Another much more accepted theory is that the colors were born among the insurgents of the southern part of Mexico, since after 1815 several flags with the three colors are known and in the known order, the most famous is the so-called Siera Flag, considered the first tricolor flag of the insurgent hosts and that guided a group of cavalry from Nicolás Bravo's troops, but there are others, one of them was taken from José María Morelos when he was captured, this one has a Mexican eagle on its shield. which is placed a Virgin of Guadalupe.

instruction: What is photosynthesis?
output:
Photosynthesis is a fundamental biological process that occurs in plants, algae and some bacteria, through which cells use the energy of sunlight to convert carbon dioxide and water into glucose (sugar) and oxygen. Photosynthesis is essential for life on Earth, as it is the main source of oxygen and is the basis of the food chain in terrestrial and aquatic ecosystems.

The process of photosynthesis takes place in chloroplasts, which are specific organelles present in the cells of plants and algae. Photosynthesis consists of two main stages:

1. Light phase (photoreduction): In this stage, chloroplasts capture energy from sunlight using photosynthetic pigments, such as chlorophyll. Light energy is converted into chemical energy stored in molecules of ATP (adenosine triphosphate) and NADPH (reduced nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide phosphate). In addition, during this stage oxygen is released as a byproduct, which is essential for the respiration of living beings.

2. Dark phase (carbon fixation): In this stage, also known as the Calvin cycle or carbon fixation cycle, the plant uses the energy stored in ATP and NADPH, produced in the light phase to convert carbon dioxide. of carbon (CO2) into glucose and other carbohydrates. The Calvin cycle is a series of chemical reactions that allow the synthesis of carbohydrates, using carbon from CO2 and stored chemical energy.

The general chemical equation for photosynthesis is as follows:

6 CO2 + 6 H2O + Light energy → C6H12O6 + 6 O2

Where:

CO2: Carbon dioxide
H2O: Water
C6H12O6: Glucose
O2: Oxygen

In summary, photosynthesis is a vital process that allows plants and other photosynthetic organisms to convert solar energy into chemical energy stored in the form of glucose, while releasing oxygen into the environment. This chemical energy is essential for the growth and functioning of living beings and for maintaining the balance of ecosystems on Earth.

instruction: What is the Big Bang theory?
output:
The Big Bang theory is the most accepted scientific explanation for the origin of the universe. It proposes that the universe began as an extremely hot and dense singularity about 13.8 billion years ago. At one point, this singularity exploded into a vast expansion, giving rise to all of space, time, and matter we know today.

As the universe expanded, it cooled and allowed the formation of atoms, stars, galaxies, and more complex cosmic structures. Evidence supporting this theory includes observations of the expansion of the universe, cosmic background radiation (a remnant of heat from the Big Bang), and the abundance of light elements such as hydrogen and helium in the universe.

The Big Bang theory has been widely confirmed by astronomical observations and scientific experiments and has had a profound impact on our understanding of the cosmos and its evolution over time.

What is failing in the care of members of the US military?

The system is overwhelmed and there are not enough specialists to treat soldiers who suffer from mental disorders when they return from war.

End of Maybe you're also interested

PTSD as a major disorder

Among them, post-traumatic stress syndrome (PTSD) is the most common disorder, above... The article continues with 4000 characters max:

From depression and substance abuse.

Is it tight to link PTSD to the high suicide rate among US military members?

"The incidence of suicide in people with PTSD or other mental disorders is high," responds Schnurr, "but the vast majority of people who suffer from PTSD do not attempt suicide. It is a serious problem, but it must be emphasized that the majority of patients do not He has a tendency to commit suicide."

More mental care by law

The president of the United States, Barack Obama, saw the alarm and decided to invest more material and human resources in psychological care for war veterans and military personnel still in service.

On August 31 of last year, he published a law decree granting more funds and more power to a set of official departments that work to care for members of the army. They are the Department of Veterans Affairs, the Secretary of Defense and the Health Service.

Between August 2012 and last March, the capacity of the Veterans Helpline was increased by 50% to ensure that veterans in crisis can receive help.

Last year, $5 billion was invested in mental health services.

From the Department of Veterans Affairs, BBC Mundo was informed that, in recent months, 15 pilot projects have been established in 7 states where said organization works in which local mental health providers help veterans have access to mental health services. mental health in time.

instruction: How important is the book The Art of Computer Programming?
output:
The book The Art of Computer Programming, by Donald Knuth, covers programming algorithms and their analysis in depth, in a formal and rigorous way. The book is divided into the following volumes:
- Volume 1: Fundamental algorithms.
- Volume 2: Semi-numeric algorithms.
- Volume 3: Sorting and searching.
- Volume 4: Combinatorial algorithms.
- Volume 5: Syntactic algorithms.
- Volume 6: Theory of context-free languages.
- Volume 7: Compilers.

To date, volumes 1,2,3 and two parts of the fourth volume have been published. Four more parts are planned in volume 4. 

This book can be considered an important source for algorithm development, but it is only recommended to people with a mathematical inclination or some experience, as it can be overwhelming.

instruction: Who was against selling indulgences to people? Considering the previous question, write a context that contains the answer. It can be from 1 to 20 sentences. The context:
output: Martin Luther was against selling indulgences to people. In the context of the Catholic church in the 16th century, the practice of selling indulgences had become common to raise funds for the construction of St. Peter's Basilica in Rome. The indulgentiaries, as the sellers of indulgences were called, claimed that by purchasing these "spiritual graces", one could have their sins forgiven or reduce their time in the flea market. However, Luther, a German monk and theologian, found the practice problematic and contrary to the teachings of the Bible. In 1517, Luther publicly challenged the sale of indulgences by publishing his famous 95 Theses, which sparked the Protestant Reformation and led to significant changes in the church and society of the time.

instruction: How old is 'too old'? (and in which countries people age better)
output:
On average, at age 65, ailments related to old age begin to manifest.

These symptoms, however, appear earlier in some people than in others.

Health problems such as hearing loss, heart attacks, injuries from falls, and neurodegenerative diseases can manifest at very different ages, depending on where a person lives.

The difference between those who "age well" and those who "age early" can be up to three decades or more.

So, for example, a 45-year-old person in Papua New Guinea feels as old as a 75-year-old person in France or Singapore. 

These are some of the conclusions of a study published in The Lancet, in which a group of scientists analyzed health data from 195 countries. 

The years do not come alone

The study analyzed aging from the point of view of well-being, and not from longevity.

The research focused on the increasing burden of diseases related to increasing age.

"These disparate findings show that longer life expectancy at older ages can be an opportunity or a threat to the overall well-being of populations, depending on the aging-related health problems that the population experiences, regardless of chronological age." says Dr. Angela Y. Chang, lead author of the study.

Researchers identified 92 ailments, which lead to irreversible deterioration in physical and mental health. The most common are cardiovascular diseases and cancer.

The calculations are adjusted to the sociodemographic indices (SDI), a measure that, in a general way, shows the development of each country.

The SDI is based on indicators such as average income, educational attainment, and total fertility rate. But while developing countries with lower SDI have shorter life expectancy, they also feel the impact of old age... \n\nGive me a good title for the article above.

instruction: What is buoyant force?
output:
The buoyant force is a force that acts on an object immersed in a fluid, such as water or air. The buoyant force is equal to the weight of the fluid that the object displaces.
The buoyant force acts in the opposite direction to the weight of the object. This means that an object floating in a fluid will have an apparent weight less than its actual weight.

Title: Pakistan announces new militant casualties from airstrikes.
Summary: The Pakistani military says at least 15 suspected militants have been killed in fresh airstrikes in the North Waziristan tribal region.
output:
The Pakistani military has reported fresh airstrikes in the North Waziristan tribal region, resulting in casualties of suspected militants. At least 15 militants have reportedly lost their lives in these operations. These attacks are part of the Pakistani government's ongoing efforts to combat the presence of militant groups in the region and ensure the safety of its citizens.

North Waziristan has long been considered a bastion of militant activity and has been the scene of clashes between Pakistani security forces and insurgent groups. Airstrikes targeting militant positions are a strategy used to weaken their infrastructure and ability to carry out violent operations.

The Pakistani army has expressed its commitment in the fight against terrorism and has carried out several counter-terrorism operations in different parts of the country. These operations have targeted not only local militant groups but also foreign elements operating on Pakistani soil.

Security in Pakistan's border region remains a major concern for the government and security forces. Airstrikes are just one of many tactics used to counter the militant threat and restore stability in the region.

However, while celebrating successes in the fight against terrorism, it is also crucial to ensure that human rights are respected and any collateral damage from attacks is avoided. The Pakistani government has reiterated its commitment to conduct operations within the limits of international law and to protect civilians at all times.

The continuation of military and security efforts in North Waziristan reinforces Pakistan's resolve to eradicate the menace of terrorism in the country and ensure peace and security for all its citizens.

instruction: What was a striped store in Mexico?
output: The tienda de raya was a credit establishment for basic supplies, located next to factories or farms and where workers or peasants were forced to make their purchases. In Mexico they were known as tiendas de raya, because the great majority of workers were illiterate and in the payroll registration book they put a line instead of their signature. Tiendas de raya in Mexico, which were no different from their similar ones in other countries such as the United States, England or France, were popular at the end of the 19th century and beginning of the 20th century during the government of Porfirio Díaz, who gave extensive concessions to businessmen and landowners, national and foreign, to exploit natural resources.

Some modern scholars, such as Fielding H. Garrison, believe that the origin of the science of geology can be traced back to Persia after the Muslim conquests came to an end. Abu al-Rayhan al-Biruni (973-1048 AD) was an early Persian geologist, whose works included the first writings on the geology of India, hypothesizing that the Indian subcontinent was once a sea. Drawing on Greek and Indian scientific literature that was not destroyed by the Muslim conquests, the Persian scholar Ibn Sina (Avicenna, 981-1037) proposed detailed explanations of mountain formation, the origin of earthquakes, and other central topics in geology. modern, which provided an essential basis for the subsequent development of science. In China, the polymath Shen Kuo (1031-1095) formulated a hypothesis for the process of land formation: based on his observation of fossil animal shells in a geological stratum on a mountain hundreds of miles from the ocean, he inferred that the Earth was formed by the erosion of mountains and the deposition of silt. 
Where does Fielding H. Garrison believe the science of geology can be traced?
output: In Persia.

instruction: What is the environmental impact of deforestation?
output: Deforestation, which is the elimination or significant reduction of forests and jungles, has serious environmental impacts. This includes the loss of biodiversity, as natural habitats are destroyed and many species face extinction due to the abrupt change in their environment. Furthermore, deforestation contributes to climate change, since trees absorb carbon dioxide (CO2) and their removal releases this gas into the atmosphere. It can also lead to soil erosion, water degradation and loss of essential ecosystem services.

Today, the Mapuche remain an important part of Chilean culture and fight to maintain their traditions and connection with nature. Their story is a reminder of the importance of protecting our natural world and respecting the indigenous cultures that have lived in harmony with it for centuries.

instruction: What is considered the best anti-war film of all time?

The film was made to celebrate the fortieth anniversary of the Soviet victory over Nazi Germany in World War II and was produced by the Mosfilm and Belarusfilm film studios. It tells through a boy named Flyora Gaishun, who is progressively hardened by suffering, the systematic massacre of the inhabitants of Belarusian villages at the hands of the Nazis during the Second World War. instruction: How is energy produced from renewable sources such as solar and wind?

How many wives did Charlemagne have? 

Answer: He had 4 wives.

Charlemagne, also known as Charles I of the Franks, had a total of four wives throughout his life. His wives were:

1. Unknown (circa 768): His first wife is unknown and it is believed that she died shortly after her marriage.
2. Hildegard of Vinzgouw (c. 771–783): She was his second wife and mother of his only legitimate child, Louis the Pious.
3. Unknown (c. 783–800): Not much is known about this third wife, who was repudiated by Charlemagne.
4. Luitgarda (c. 794–800): She was his fourth wife and mother of two of his sons, Lothair and Berengar.

It is worth mentioning that Charlemagne also had several concubines and relationships outside of marriage.

instruction: What important event is this text about?: In 1905, a first revolution took place after the Russian defeat by Japan in the Russo-Japanese War. On January 22, a demonstration was called in Saint Petersburg to demand reforms from Tsar Nicholas II, which was harshly repressed, on what is known as Bloody Sunday. It was an attempt by the Russian people to free themselves from their tsar and was characterized by uprisings and strikes by workers and peasants. These formed the first organs of power independent of the protection of the State: the soviets and, especially, the Saint Petersburg Soviet.
output: The text is about the Russian Revolution of 1905, also known as the 1905 Revolution or the 1905 Uprising. This historic event took place in the Russian Empire in the year 1905 and was a mass demonstration and uprising of the Russian people against Tsar Nicholas II and the autocratic regime. The revolution was largely triggered due to Russia's defeat by Japan in the Russo-Japanese War and the difficult social and economic conditions faced by workers and peasants at the time. Bloody Sunday, which occurred on January 22, 1905 in St. Petersburg, was a tragic event in which a peaceful demonstration was harshly suppressed by government forces, which escalated protests and uprisings across the country. During this period, the first independent state power organs were formed - the Soviets, which would play a significant role in the Russian Revolution of 1917.

instruction: Has any president died while in office? Consider the nation of the United States.
output:
Yes, some United States presidents have died while in office. Throughout American history, there have been four presidents who died while in office:

1. William Henry Harrison: He was the ninth president of the United States and took office on March 4, 1841. However, he died on April 4, 1841 (Pneumonia), just 31 days after assuming the presidency, making him becomes the president with the shortest term in history.

2. Zachary Taylor: He was the twelfth president of the United States and took office on March 4, 1849. He died on July 9, 1850, approximately one year and four months after assuming the presidency, from acute gastroenteritis.

3. Abraham Lincoln: He was the sixteenth president of the United States and took office on March 4, 1861. Lincoln was assassinated on April 14, 1865, shot in the back of the head, approximately four years after assumed the presidency, becoming the first president to be assassinated.

4. James A. Garfield: He was the 20th president of the United States and took office on March 4, 1881. He was seriously wounded by a gunman on July 2, 1881 and finally died from his wounds on July 19. September 1881.

5. William McKinley: He was the twenty-fifth president of the United States and took office on March 4, 1897. He was the victim of an attack on September 6, 1901 and died from his injuries on September 14, 1901.

6. Warren G. Harding: He was the twenty-ninth president of the United States and took office on March 4, 1921. Harding died on August 2, 1923, from a heart attack.

7. Franklin D. Roosevelt: He was the thirty-second president of the United States and took office on March 4, 1933. Roosevelt died on April 12, 1945, approximately three months into his fourth term, making him The longest-serving president in American history died of a brain hemorrhage. 

8. John F. Kennedy: He was the thirty-fifth president of the United States and took office on January 20, 1961. Tragically, he was assassinated on November 22, 1963, while on a visit to Dallas, Texas.

These presidents died tragically while in office, and their deaths had a significant impact on American history.

instruction: Explain the cosine theorem.
output:
The theorem or rule or law of cosines is a generalization of the Pythagorean theorem for non-right triangles. This says that the square of the length of any one side is equal to the sum of the squares of the lengths of the other two sides, minus twice the product of those two sides multiplied by the cosine of the angle opposite the first mentioned side.

More precisely, if we have a triangle whose sides are a,b,c and the interior angles opposite these sides are alpha, beta and gamma respectively, then:

c^2 = a^2 + b^2 - 2*a*b*cos(gamma)

We can see that the Pythagorean theorem is a particular case of this theorem, since when gamma=90 degrees, we obtain cos(gamma) = 0, and therefore c^2 = a^2 + b^2.

instruction: How many types of dinosaurs existed?
output:
A wide variety of dinosaur species have been identified and classified over time, but estimating the exact number of dinosaur types can be an ever-evolving challenge due to new research and discoveries. Although a precise and definitive number cannot be provided, it is estimated that around 1,000 different genera of dinosaurs have been described and cataloged to date.

Dinosaurs varied in size, shape, diet and habitat. They are grouped into several main categories based on their characteristics, and are classified into two main groups: Saurischia (reptile-hipped) and Ornithischia (bird-hipped).

Each group is divided into subgroups and then into genera and species. Some of the best-known dinosaur genera and species include:

- Theropods: This group includes famous predators such as Tyrannosaurus rex and Velociraptor.

- Sauropods: Sauropods were long-necked herbivorous dinosaurs, like Brachiosaurus and Diplodocus.

- Ornithopods: These herbivores include iguanodonts and hadrosaurs, such as Parasaurolophus.

- Marginocephalians: This group includes the ceratopsians, which had horns and ornamental structures, like Triceratops.

- Feathered theropods: It has been discovered that some theropods had feathers, which relates them to modern birds. Examples include Archeopteryx.

It should be noted that the classification of dinosaurs continues to be the subject of research and debate in the scientific community. New fossils and genetic analyzes continue to shed light on the diversity and relationship between different dinosaur species. As more fossil remains are discovered and research techniques are refined, our understanding of the variety of dinosaur types will continue to evolve.

instruction: Give me an original food recipe, with Japanese, Peruvian and Chilean influence, for a party of 30 guests, with the ingredients and preparation step by step.
output:
Clear! Here you have an original recipe that combines Japanese, Peruvian and Chilean influences: "Nikkei Salmon Ceviche".

Ingredients for 30 guests:

For the ceviche:

2 kg of fresh salmon, skinned and cut into small cubes.
10 limes (juice).
4 oranges (juice).
2 cups of coconut milk.
1 tablespoon grated ginger.
1 teaspoon yellow chili paste (you can find it in Peruvian product stores).
2 tablespoons soy sauce (soy sauce).
1 tablespoon sesame oil.
1 large red onion, finely chopped.
1 cup of fresh cooked corn.
1 cup cooked edamame (soy beans).
1 ripe avocado, cut into cubes.
2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro.
2 tablespoons of chopped chives.

To accompany:

Corn toast or banana chips.
Step by step preparation:

In a large bowl, mix the lime juice, orange juice, coconut milk, grated ginger, yellow chili paste, soy sauce, and sesame oil to make the marinade.

Add the salmon cubes to the marinade and mix well to coat them completely. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes so the salmon can marinate properly.

While the salmon marinates, prepare the ingredients to accompany the ceviche. Finely chop the red onion, cilantro and chives. Cook the corn and soy beans until tender.

Once the salmon is marinated, remove the plastic wrap and add the red onion, corn, soy beans, and avocado cubes to the bowl. Mix gently to combine all ingredients.

Cover the bowl again with plastic wrap and refrigerate for another 20-30 minutes to allow the flavors to blend and the salmon to finish "cooking" in the citrus juice.

Before serving, sprinkle the cilantro and chopped chives over the ceviche.

Serve the Nikkei salmon ceviche on corn toast or with plantain chips on the side.

Ready! Now you have a delicious and original recipe that combines Japanese, Peruvian and Chilean influences to surprise your 30 guests at the party. I hope you enjoy!

instruction: How many days are there in a leap year?
output: A leap year has 366 days, one day more than a common year, which has 365 days. This additional day is added to correct the gap that exists between the duration of the tropical year: 365 days 5 h 48 min 45.10 s (365.242189 days) and the calendar year of 365 days. This requires that every four years the calendar year be corrected for an unaccounted accumulation of approximately 1/4 day per year.
